CatDescriptText: Gloria Williams, college student, Cheyney, Pa and John Pope, insurance agent, Whitehall, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 8, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think there will be a Third World War?  If so, what do you think will be the cause or causes?" Gloria Williams' answer reads: "No, because I think the heads of the nations can't afford World War III.  I think that Khrushchev and President Kennedy realize that atomic warfare will destroy the world."  John Pope's answer reads: "I believe that if it does happen, it will be because of the ultimate inability of capitalism and communism to exist simultaneously."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Gloria Williams holding newspaper, gloves, and wallet, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of John Pope wearing stingy brim hat and trench coat, standing in front of Bud Saunders Flowers, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
